Events that occurred on 9 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1914 - Artist Tove Jansson is born.
1923 - Voice actor John Stephenson is born.
1932 - Voice actor Denys Hawthorne is born.
1934 - Tolkien's portrait by artist F.A. Farrell is published in the Australian Catholic journal The Advocate.
1945 â€“ As the bombs are dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Tolkien denounces these tactics as "utter folly".
1973 - The last known photograph of J.R.R. Tolkien is taken, in front of his favourite tree, the Pinus Nigra (named Laocoon), at the Botanic Garden in Oxford.
1981 - The twenty-third episode of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1981 - Mythcon 12 at Mills College in Oakland, California.
1986 - Mythcon 17 at California State University in Long Beach.
1997 - Mythcon 28 at Pepperdine University in Malibu, California.
2005 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony plays in Herodion, Greece.
2007 - Omentielva Tatya - 2nd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Antwerp, Belgium.
2009 - Omentielva Nelya - 3rd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Whitehaven, England.
2013 - Omentielva Lempea - 5th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Helsinki, Finland.
2014 - Mythcon 45 in Wheaton College, Massachusetts.
2015 - Omentielva Enquea - Sixth International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Greisinger Museum, Switzerland.
2022 - Tolkien Calendar 2023 is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
